N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6653.6 - EISEP services in area plans

State Regulations
(a) An area agency participating in EISEP may
propose expanded nonmedical in-home, noninstitutional respite, case management, and ancillary services for functionally impaired elderly pursuant to section
6653.1
of this Part. (b) Each EISEP service in the area plan shall
specify: (1)
its intended goals and
objectives; (2)
the elderly
population to be served; (3)
proposed methods to assure correct use of the standardized assessment procedure
prescribed by the office pursuant to this Chapter; and
(4)
proposed methods to implement the
cost-sharing requirements of this Chapter, including provision of an
opportunity for applicants for or recipients of EISEP services to contest
determinations of functional ineligibility or levels of required cost-sharing
(provided, however, that, despite functional eligibility, an area agency may
deny services to applicants based on lack of program resources, and further
provided that no entitlement to services is created under this

Chapter). (c) The area
plan shall assure that no expanded nonmedical in-home service, noninstitutional
respite service, or ancillary service under EISEP will be provided except
pursuant to an assessment of functional impairment and continuing case
management services as prescribed by the office. Notes
